009package imagingbook.common.mser;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
015import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.Eigensolver2x2;
016import imagingbook.common.mser.components.Component;
017
018/**
019 * Defines a container holding the data for calculating MSER properties.
020 * Instances of this type are attached to {@link Component} objects during
021 * MSER calculation in {@link MserDetector}.
022 */
023public class MserData {
024        
025        private final Component<MserData> component;    // reference to associated component
026        
027        /** True iff the associated component is a MSER. */
028        protected boolean isMserP = false;
029        
030        /** Component size variation (wrt. to the size at delta levels higher), undefined = -1 */
031        protected float variation = -1;
032        
033        /** Component stability status */
034        protected boolean isStable = true;
035        
036        /** Component coordinate ordinary moments (m10, m01, m20, m02, m11) */
037        protected long[] stats = null;
038        
039        /** Central moments of pixel coordinates (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11) */
040        private double[] moments = null;
041        
042        /** Reference to the equivalent ellipse */
043        private GeometricEllipse ellipse = null;
044        
045        
046        /**
047         * Constructor.
048         * @param c the associated {@link Component}
049         */
050        public MserData(Component<MserData> c) {
051                this.component = c;
052        }
053        
054        
055        /**
056         * Returns true iff the associated component is a MSER.
057         * @return true iff a MSER
058         */
059        public boolean isMser() {
060                return isMserP;
061        }
062        
063        /**
064         * Returns the vector of central moments (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11)
065         * for the pixel coordinates contained in the associated component.
066         * @return the vector of central moments
067         */
068        public double[] getCentralMoments() {
069                return this.moments;
070        }
071        
072        /**
073         * Returns the covariance matrix for the pixel coordinates contained
074         * in the associated component.
075         * @return the covariance matrix 
076         */
077        public double[][] getCovarianceMatrix() {
078                double[] mu = getCentralMoments(); // = (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11)
079                final int size = component.getSize();
080                double[][] S = {
081                                {mu[2]/size, mu[4]/size},
082                                {mu[4]/size, mu[3]/size}};
083                return S;
084        }
085        
086        /**
087         * Returns the center point for the associated component.
088         * @return the center point
089         */
090        public PntDouble getCenter() {
091                double mu10 = moments[0];
092                double mu01 = moments[1];
093                return PntDouble.from(mu10, mu01);
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Returns the equivalent ellipse for the associated component.
098         * @return the equivalent ellipse
099         */
100        public GeometricEllipse getEllipse() {
101                return this.ellipse;
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Calculates the central moments and the equivalent ellipse
106         * for the associated component.
107         */
108        protected void init() {
109                calculateMoments();
110                makeEllipse();
111        }
112        
113        private void calculateMoments() {
114                double n = component.getSize();
115                double mu10 = stats[0] / n;
116                double mu01 = stats[1] / n;
117                double mu20 = stats[2] - stats[0] * stats[0] / n; // = size times the covariance, see Book p.750
118                double mu02 = stats[3] - stats[1] * stats[1] / n;
119                double mu11 = stats[4] - stats[0] * stats[1] / n;
120                this.moments = new double[] {mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11};
121        }
122        
123        private void makeEllipse() {
124                final double n = component.getSize();
125                final double mu10 = moments[0];
126                final double mu01 = moments[1];
127                final double mu20 = moments[2];
128                final double mu02 = moments[3];
129                final double mu11 = moments[4];
130                Eigensolver2x2 es = new Eigensolver2x2(mu20, mu11, mu11, mu02);
131                double ra = 2 * Math.sqrt(es.getRealEigenvalue(0) / n); // correct (see Book p.238)
132                double rb = 2 * Math.sqrt(es.getRealEigenvalue(1) / n);
133                double[] x1 = es.getEigenvector(0).toArray();
134                double theta = Math.atan2(x1[1], x1[0]);
135                this.ellipse = new GeometricEllipse(ra, rb, mu10, mu01, theta);
136        }
137        
138//      /**
139//       * Sorts a list of MSERs by (decreasing) component size, i.e.,
140//       * the largest MSER (with the most pixels) becomes the first.
141//       * 
142//       * @param msers a list of {@link MSER} instances
143//       */
144//      public static void sortBySize(List<Component<MserData>> msers) {
145//              Comparator<Component<MserData>> cmp = new Comparator<Component<MserData>>() {
146//                      @Override
147//                      public int compare(Component<MserData> mser1, Component<MserData> mser2) {
148//                              return Integer.compare(mser2.getSize(), mser1.getSize());
149//                      }
150//              };
151//              Collections.sort(msers, cmp);
152//      }
153
154        @Override
155        public String toString() {
156                return String.format("variation=%.2f stability=%d stats=%s",
157                                variation, isStable, (stats == null) ? "x" : Arrays.toString(stats));
158        }
159        
160
161}
